name: Madre Tierra Hotel Spa Restaurant

reviews.text: The Madre Tierra is a beautiful property with very hospitable and engaging managers and staff. We spent 4 days here and the experience could not have been better. The rooms are beautiful and uniquely constructed with some exceptionally artistic touches including creative rock and tile work. The food prepared at the hotel is cheap and exceptionally healthy. I especially appreciated spending time with the owner and his family. I have traveled extensively in South America and the Madre Tierrra is among the most beautiful, unique, and hospitable hotels anywhere.
reviews.title: the place to stay in Vilcabampa

reviews.text: Every time we go to Ecuador we plan our trips accordingly. i start by looking at hotel reco's on trip advisor in cities we plan to visit. This one was by far right on the money! This place is amazing! for the nature lovers, this is your paradise. The rooms are spacious, clean, accommodating all sizes. Though we were lucky to have called before we arrived - folks should try to book ahead - but we got very lucky to have arrived in Loja and then venture out to Vilcabamba soon after and have three rooms available!
reviews.title: All Natural Beauty !

reviews.text: This place is owned and run by an American family - very friendly! sweet folks. There is hot water, an amazing restaurant on premises. Now i am your average picky traveler - so much i check all mattresses before actually putting our stuff down.. (call me paranoid).
reviews.title: A great place to relax and enjoy Vilcabamba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I only wish we had enough days to stay but we only stayed overnight. Highly recommend this place!
reviews.title: Exquisite Inn with fabulous owners

reviews.text: Madre Tierra is a lovely property with fantastic views (yeah, I wish I was sitting in a hammock on a porch overlooking the dramatic southern Ecuador scenery right now, I admit it). It is a great place to relax and unwind, and would be a fabulous setting for a yoga retreat or similar sort of vacation. The staff is very friendly and helpful (owners are USA-born, so it's easy to schedule your stay and ask questions), and the spa services are inexpensive and convenient (I recommend the facial). The only thing that was unanticipated was how close the property is to the Pan-American Highway, which is convenient (it's a $1 cab ride or a 15 minute walk to Vilcabamba) but does mean you may hear traffic along the road occasionally. The food at the restaurant is good but not spectacular (soup and salad is always a good bet). But overall, this is a great spot and definitely worth a visit!
reviews.title: We had to come back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both...I live in Loja and traveled to Vilcabamba for the first time last week. My landlord directed me to Madre Tierra..I am glad she did. We stayed in a superior room (all have patios) and it was magnificant. The lush landscaping and views are tremendous. In a word it is a destination..relax and enjoy. Swimming pool, Spa and resturant are all above average. The staff is bilingual and always helpful and attentive. The owners live on the property and are engaged in the daily operation. The Kitchen is immaculate and the food stuffs are fresh daily. They grow much of their produce and fruits..you will see fruit trees outside you cabina. The bread was so good I got a loaf to go..baked on the property. The menu is excellent (under priced vs quality) and we only dined out once (lunch) away (disappointed with what was touted as a great Mexican spot). I was looking for a close getaway and have found the spot..looking forward to many weekend trips..huge music library..casual and unhurried..My dog loved it too!
reviews.title: Visit Vilcabamba or Madre Tierra ?

reviews.text: Madre Tierra was the best place for me to come and just crash, heal and process. I cannot begin to describe my gratitude and admiration for the staff at Madre Tierra. Everyone was going out of their way to make this a pleasant stay. Jill was absolutely exquisite at managing the place while gale and Peter were gone. There is much flexibility for accommodating special requests, especially when it comes to the food.
reviews.title: If you just need to crash and be taken care of....

reviews.text: One of the main reasons for me to go back and not to another hotel when I was the second time in Vilcabamba. The food is great as it is with many delicious vegetarian options aside from the usual pasta and pizza dishes, but still, there is never a problem in regards to special orders/changes of dishes.
reviews.title: WOW! The Best Gets Better in Vilcabamba Ecuador
A Clean Green Friendly Space
reviews.text: The Spa is out of this world. I had the 3 hour relax special, it was simply so amazing that i went back the next day for a full body massage - again extraordinary. I have taken a day to look at other places to stay but will always choose Madre Tierra.

Ishcaluma is more quiet but does not have the warmth and tranqui motherly healing vibes of Madre Tierra. Its too German for me, but maybe that is because I am German:) You hear a little bit of the road at MT but oddly enough that has never bothered me there. Whenever I need to crash that's where i'll go again.
reviews.title: Madre Tierra- Worth The Visit

reviews.text: I loved this place. The room was great. They have a spa,which was nice. The place is organized, has great margaritas, and the food is good. Only one small complaint and that is a little noise from my side of the rooms from the road. I will go back and I may get the same room again, so it could not have been that bad.
reviews.title: Great place to relax

reviews.text: Our family recently stayed at this wonderful resort. We really enjoyed the unique spa treatments, the amazing food, the friendly and helpful staff, and the spectacular surrounding scenery. Being in the health and wellness business I was very pleased to see their focus on organic, natural and eco friendly approaches to their offerings. The family that owns and operates the facility was very accommodating and fun to visit with. Our only regret was that we didn't stay longer in this piece of paradise.
reviews.title: Family trip to Madre Tierra

reviews.text: A unique hotel with amazing views and friendly staff. They made this visit to Vilcabamba a delight.
reviews.title: APRIL 2013

reviews.text: Each room features novel stone work in bathrooms. If there was one drawback, and I found this in most South American hotels, they fail to provide tea and coffee making equipment. Just a little criticism but easy enough to live without.
reviews.title: Rat's crawling on my roof all night and the roosters crowing all night

reviews.text: If you are looking for peace and a good nights sleep don't bother here. Very noisy with Roosters nearby crowing all night also there was a rat on my roof who came out at night just loud enough to hear him all night. Breakfast is free but if you ask for a slightly larger bowl of fruit they charge you 3 dollars. The bowl they gave me had about 3 bites in it a total joke. The bread is made by a equadorian lady on -site but she did'nt have the decency to stay home when she or her son were sick and sneezing with a terrible cold blowing his spray right into the bread for the guests in the morning. I arrived there unaware and got sick the next day and my cold lasted for 4 days.
reviews.title: Magical Madre Tierra

reviews.text: This is a very comfortable hotel. There are a variety of rooms, from basic to luxe. I stayed in room 20 and had a great view of the adjacent mountains from the large attached patio, which featured a hammock.
reviews.title: I really liked this hotel

reviews.text: Breakfasts are wonderful, hearty and appetizing, but beware of dinners because the cooks there don't always prepare food the way they're described on the menu (i.e. they smothered my pizza with mushrooms when I didn't ask for them). But Peter, the owner, offered me a free breakfast the next morning. Meal prices are fair, as are beverages.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: Taxis into town, about 1 km away, are easily available from the hotel for about $1. Views from the outdoor restaurant are great, morning coffee is superb.
reviews.title: The best place in Vilcabamba!

reviews.text: Be sure to get a massage from the woman in the spa.
reviews.title: Good vibes!

reviews.text: I would definitely stay at Madre Tierra again. Be sure to check out several of the rooms before deciding on which to take.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

description: The Madre Tierra Eco Resort and Spa in Vilcabamba near Loja, Ecuador. Come enjoy organic food from our garden, prepared in our open kitchen. The Spa offers a full range of treatments with an emphasis on relaxation and detoxification. Each room is unique and many feature beautiful views, private balconies and hammocks. Our smoothie bar will satisfy your cravings with healthy drinks that taste great! WiFi is included for our guests along with a complementary breakfast.
